1: ## Module:      WebUI
3: # The Shinken web interface and integrated web server.
5: module_name     WebUI
6: module_type     webui
7: host            0.0.0.0     ; All interfaces = 0.0.0.0
8: port            7767
9: auth_secret     xingxing   ; CHANGE THIS or someone could forge
10: ; cookies!!
11: allow_html_output   0       ; Allow or not HTML chars in plugins output.
12: ; WARNING: Allowing can be a security issue.
13: max_output_length   100     ; Maximum output length for plugin output in webui
14: manage_acl          1       ; Use contacts ACL. 0 allow actions for all.
15: play_sound          0       ; Play sound on new non-acknowledged problems.
16: login_text      Welcome on Shinken WebUI    ; Text in the login form.
19: # - Apache_passwd   = Use an htpasswd file for auth backend.
20: # - ActiveDir_UI    = Use AD for auth backend (and retrieve photos).
21: # - Cfg_password    = Use the password setted in Shinken contact for auth.
22: # - PNP_UI          = Use PNP graphs in the UI.
23: # - GRAPHITE_UI     = Use graphs from Graphite time series database.
24: # - Mongodb         = Save user preferences to a Mongodb database
25: # - SQLitedb        = Save user preferences to a SQLite database
26: modules             Apache_passwd, ActiveDir_UI, Cfg_password, PNP_UI, Mongodb, Glances_UI
28: # Don't use them as long as you don't know what you are doing!
29: http_backend            auto    ; Choice is: auto, wsgiref, cherrypy, flup,
30: ; flupscgi, paste, tornado, twisted or gevent.
31: ; Leave auto to find the best available.
32: #remote_user_enable      1       ; If WebUI is behind a web server which
34: #remote_user_enable      2       ; Look for remote user in the WSGI environment
35: ; instead of the HTTP header. This allows
37: ; integration, eg. with the apache modules.
38: #remote_user_variable    X_Remote_User  ; Set to the HTTP header containing
39: ; the authentificated user s name, which
41: # If you got external plugins (pages) to load on webui

1: ## Modules for WebUI
2: # - Apache_passwd   = Use an htpasswd file for auth backend.
3: # - ActiveDir_UI    = Use AD for auth backend (and retrieve photos).
4: # - Cfg_password    = Use the password setted in Shinken contact for auth.
5: # - PNP_UI          = Use PNP graphs in the UI.
6: # - GRAPHITE_UI     = Use graphs from Graphite time series database.
7: # - Mongodb         = Save user preferences to a Mongodb database
8: # - SQLitedb        = Save user preferences to a SQLite database
9: modules             Apache_passwd, ActiveDir_UI, Cfg_password, PNP_UI, Mongodb, Glances_UI
10: ## Advanced Options
11: # Don't use them as long as you don't know what you are doing!
12: http_backend            auto    ; Choice is: auto, wsgiref, cherrypy, flup,
13: ; flupscgi, paste, tornado, twisted or gevent.
14: ; Leave auto to find the best available.
15: #remote_user_enable      1       ; If WebUI is behind a web server which
17: #remote_user_enable      2       ; Look for remote user in the WSGI environment
18: ; instead of the HTTP header. This allows
20: ; integration, eg. with the apache modules.
21: #remote_user_variable    X_Remote_User  ; Set to the HTTP header containing
22: ; the authentificated user s name, which
24: # If you got external plugins (pages) to load on webui

7: # Don't use them as long as you don't know what you are doing!
8: http_backend            auto    ; Choice is: auto, wsgiref, cherrypy, flup,
9: ; flupscgi, paste, tornado, twisted or gevent.

11: #remote_user_enable      1       ; If WebUI is behind a web server which

13: #remote_user_enable      2       ; Look for remote user in the WSGI environment
